column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////I can only speak for the patisserie as I haven't actually sat down for a meal. But if the real food is anything like the baked goods
column2: then I'm going to have to sit down and try it. Common Bond is a bit pricey and the lines can go out the door but it's so worth it. Everything always tastes fresh and they don't skimp on the fillings
column4: etc. Their cookies are a must try and are giant discs of chocolately goodness. Croissants are nice and flaky. I try different things everytime I go
column5: and I am never disappointed. Service is also very friendly especially considering how hectic the place can get.
